title: Elveden Estate Walks

images.title: Keith Evans / Elveden war memorial
images.caption: Elveden war memorial. Next to the busy A.11 a major land mark for holiday makers to let them know they are in Suffolk. Commissioned by the Earl of Iveagh to commemorate the 48 men from Elveden, Icklingham and Eriswell who died in the first world war. It is situated at the point were the three parishes meet. It stands 113 feet high with a staircase inside with 148 steps and is the tallest war memorial in Suffolk and one of the tallest such memorials in Great Britain.

images.title: Ron Strutt / Elveden church
images.caption: Elveden church. The second tower, in the background, is linked to the church by a covered colonnade, leading towards Elveden Hall.

images.title: Geoff Pick / Track, Elveden Estate
images.caption: Track, Elveden Estate. The Earl of Iveagh's historic country estate. The earl is a direct descendant of the Guinness family.

images.title: Bob Jones / Track to High Lodge
images.caption: Track to High Lodge

images.title: Berner's Heath by Keith Evans, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Berner's Heath

description: This walk explores the Elveden Estate in the West Suffolk village of Elveden. The historic estate surrounds Elveden Hall, a large stately home dating mainly from the Georgian period. From the village you can follow a track south across the estate with nice views of the surrounding countryside. The Icknield Way Path runs across the estate. You could pick this up and follow it east to explore Berner's Heath. The Duke's Ride is a track that can also be used for cycling which runs to the heath. If you follow the Icknield Way north east you can visit Thetford Heath and the town of Thetford where there are some lovely riverside walks. You can also explore the expansive Thetford Forest in this area.
